Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou! Hey, Kanchou!
Kanchou, I'm talking to you!

Fields.MenuText: Kaga, what's wrong?
Kaga, settle down!
I swear I will turn you around!

Fields.DialogueText: I'll tell you what's wrong! It's these damn radios. More unreliable than a wooden lighter.
I wouldn't have to if we had a functioning radio system!
Take me back to Yokosuka while we're at it. They need to fix my radios!
What's the point of yelling over the radio if you can appear wherever you like?
Even I can't be everywhere at once, Kanchou. You of all people should know this.
If only. It looks like the Morganas have that all figured out.
That's just what those demons want you to think. We should be the ones keeping them guessing.
Here's our chance.
@BATTLE
... Kuso. All right, Plan B.
KANCHOU!
HEY, MORGANAS! THESE ARE IMPERIAL WATERS YOU'RE FOULING UP!
Maybe she has a point about those radios...
Bridge to Kaga. Do you copy?
Bridge to Kaga. How copy? Over.
Copy, Kanchou.
Finally. Almost as if you were-
-Right behind you?

Fields.MenuText: Don't scare me like that!
Damn. Still nothing.
Very funny. Try again?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't let your guard down!
You see what I mean?
Suru hitsuyō ga nai. I think I've made my point.
What's the deal with your radios?
Hell if I know, Kanchou. They clearly didn't survive my last reconstruction.
Can't you tell?
If I decked you, would you be able to tell which blood vessels I'd broken?
Of course not. Is that a threat?
Of course not. But you'd know that it hurt. That's where I'm at with this radio thing. Let me at it sometime. I was getting bored anyway.
If you can fix it, I'm all for it.
Right after I fix these Funayūrei!
@BATTLE
Got it. Ahem... Kaga, how copy? Over,
Loud and clear, Kanchou! Over!
Crystal. Well done.
Of course it was! I'm on the case.
Nobody knows you better than you.
Damn straight! I reckon I could captain myself if it came down to it.
Well, regulations do say that in the event of my death-
DON'T TALK LIKE THAT!

Fields.MenuText: Be calm, Kaga! I was just thinking out loud.
My apologies, Kaga. Be at peace.
Didn't you just... ?

Fields.DialogueText: Sumimasen, Kanchou. I just don't like to think of things like that.
Death isn't something I like to consider, is all.
I mean like if you were incapacitated! You're the one who brought up death.
Right, I'll steer clear of it.
No harm done, Kanchou. We can't always dance around it. Just... whenever possible.
Here come the Morganas to help with that.
@BATTLE
All right, Kanchou, I'm off to the boilers. Try it now!
Sonoaida! All this radio stuff has me thinking. There's plenty else about me that needs shoring up.
Damn it! Planes in the sky. Those radios are getting a torture test!
Kaga?
Here, Kanchou.
Must you smoke so?
Like a chimney, Kanchou. Helps sharpen the focus.
Having trouble coming up with improvements?
Ha! Flattered, Kanchou, but you don't have to sugarcoat it. I'm a mess.

Fields.MenuText: Don't be so hard on yourself.
I could have told you that.
Other than the smoking, I wouldn't change a thing.

Fields.DialogueText: No, really. My fuel tanks are vulnerable, my fire suppression's crap, and don't even get me started on the AA guns.
And I could have switched on the sprinklers in your quarters. Aren't we both the picture of self-control?
Shows what you know.
I'm good, Kanchou. But "good" isn't innate. It takes work to stay sharp.
You'll have no shortage of that out here. The seas are crawling with Morganas.
Practice isn't enough. All the fastballs in the world won't heal a broken arm.
If there's anything broken on the ship, I want to be the first to know about it.
Second.
... Right.
Enough about my flaws. Funayūrei inbound!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, is this a good time?
As good as any. What's on your mind?
You asked about my flaws. I've prepared a brief for you that should bring you up to speed.

Fields.MenuText: My, my, this looks... comprehensive.
It's even annotated with some of my possible questions. Interesting.
A brief doesn't usually have footnotes and cross-references, Kaga.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, yeah, rub it in. Now we can start coming up with fixes.
I hate making small talk when we could be solving problems.
Choppy conversations can sink to the bottom. I find them... what's the word... pesky.
Well, I think we can find a good starting point with this. Thank you, Kaga.
If you like what you see there, perhaps you could call me Lady Kaga?
Are you...
That's a joke, Kanchou. You do understand jokes, don't you?
I do. I just didn't know you did.
It becomes less of a joke the more I think about it.
We'll explore that another time. First, I need to read this. I'll get back to you when I'm finished.
Shoot now, read later! Unless you think the Morganas need a bedtime story.
@BATTLE
Kaga, I've read your briefing material and... Kaga?
Here, Kanchou.
I couldn't see you.
But I could still hear you. Kind of like an anchor, right? Just because you don't see me doesn't mean I'm not keeping you grounded.
I don't think I'm the one that needs grounding.
A carrier's nothing without her planes!
What I couldn't find was information regarding our guns. You know we're armed for close quarters as well as sorties, yes?
What difference does that make?

Fields.MenuText: If I had to guess, I'd say you don't care so much about guns?
Aren't all of our men and their jobs important to you?
Shells take up time, space, and manpower, Kaga. Shouldn't we count their successes as well?

Fields.DialogueText: Who cares about guns when you have bombers?
The whole point of air superiority is to win without having to look at your enemy's ugly mug.
If we happen to need them, absolutely.
Bombers are useful, but we can't rely on just one strategy for victory.
I'm not just built to win, Kanchou, I'm built to crush!
What if an enemy gets inside our range?
@BATTLE
Contact! We'll keep that button handy, Kanchou, but I'm sure as hell not going to be the one to press it!
Must've missed that last bit, Kanchou. Radios, am I right?
... Right. Anyway. I enjoyed the brief you wrote me, especially your assessment of your sortie capability.
Fine, I've got plenty of guns for that! But if we let them get close, we've failed already. Would you be satisfied pushing a button marked "WIN THE BATTLE?"
With the fate of the world at stake? Probably.
Kaga to the bridge.
Already here. Cigarette?
No, thank you. We've spotted Morganas and we're moving to engage. I wanted your advice.
Advice, nothing. This is a partnership.

Fields.MenuText: How better to test one of my crew than by fire? What say you?
Just give me your opinion.
I only ask as a courtesy, of course.

Fields.DialogueText: Send in the bombers and pound them from a distance.
I recommend torpedo planes... followed by guns, should they stagger within our range.
Whatever you think is best then, Kanchou. I've got a Belle's veto in my pocket, but this shouldn't be a tough one.
Thank you, Kaga. I'll keep that under advisement as we proceed.
Under advisement? Why ask if you're only going to do what you want to do in the first place?
We all have orders, Kami. Helm, move to engage.
@BATTLE
Orders are useless if you don't know what you're ordering. At least you read the brief.
I must say that your tactical thinking is... interesting, Kanchou.
I'm just going by what I learned. We've kind of had to throw out a lot of it since you Belles appeared.
Ha!
What?
You've got it all backwards, Kanchou. Belles hit harder and live faster than sleeping ships. Do everything you do, but bigger.
How do you feel, then? Do I fulfill that?
My honest opinion?

Fields.MenuText: I'd have no other.
I expect that at all times, yes.
I'll give you mine if you give me yours.

Fields.DialogueText: Your exploits more than make up for your flaws. So far.
Concerned, but victory erases all doubts.
I'd expect nothing less. There's no improvement without honesty. And honestly... you're improving.
I appreciate that, Kaga.
@BATTLE
Good for you. Don't let it make you complacent. We're about to put my confidence in you to the test!
Kaga to the-
Can it wait, Kanchou?
Can an order wait?
Just for... oh, thirty seconds.

Fields.MenuText: It was an order. Those can't wait.
No more.
Twenty.

Fields.DialogueText: In the military sense, yes. Between Captain and Belle, you need a little more force to make it stick.
No need!
Challenge accepted!
Annnnnnd done. What did you need, Kanchou?
Your presence. We're in Morgana territory.
Exactly why I was below decks. If there's any weaknesses in my structure, I want to know about them.
Well, we need unity in our military response.
You read my brief, didn't you? We need preparedness and stability!
My point exactly.
@BATTLE
I'll make my point all over these Funayūrei!
Kaga to the bridge... please.
Please? Who are you and where is the real Kanchou?
You're dutiful by nature, and clearly you keep up to speed on our situation. I didn't want to interrupt you at something important.
And will you take my tactical advice now?
As I said, we all have our orders.
And what exactly are your orders?
At the moment, to defeat the enemy. That's why I asked you here.
I don't see anything on the horizon...
They're there, don't doubt it. We've received radio intelligence that we've Morganas headed our way. We have you to thank for that.
I thought that was all you.
I can pinpoint the wound, but I let the experts sew it up. Decide, Kanchou. Am I your tool or am I your companion?

Fields.MenuText: Strictly speaking...
A little bit of both.
You're right. I should defer to you.

Fields.DialogueText: Tighten your grip and just see how far that gets you.
I'm nobody's weapon but the Emperor's. If I pick you to wield me, you'd better be up to the task.
Not about everything, but about some things. Well, a lot of things.
So what should our next priority be?
@BATTLE
And my complement of engineers. Now there's some folks who know what they're doing.
For now, turning these Funayūrei into a fireworks festival. Then you and I are going to have a long talk about how best to maximize my potential...
So that's your primary solution? Bomb them until their ears bleed?
Their surface defenses are impressive, but their air defenses are minimal. We're better suited to this mission and you know it!
Battleships are better suited according to high command. Their range...
... Doesn't even approach ours! We can hit them from such a distance that they won't even know we're coming until we've left.
A solution also delivered by battleship guns.
Sure, if you want to mess around with indirect fire. This isn't a trench war, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: Orders are orders, Kaga, and we'll do as we're told.
Well, we can't yet go on the offensive.
We can't always play the hero.

Fields.DialogueText: Even when the orders are terrible?
We can't keep waiting around for an opportunity either!
To hell with heroics! I'm just sick of harassing the enemy when we could pick them off ourselves.
My hands are tied. Take it up with the INPF.
@BATTLE
If you're trying to rile me up before a Morgana encounter, Kanchou, it's working.
Why, I just might!
Don't be surprised if your letter becomes more of a collector's item than a recommendation.
Grr...
I thought I smelled smoke.
This is nothing. You should have seen me before my last reconstruction.
Can you at least make that smoke disappear?
Do I look like Fūjin? No, I can't make it just disappear!

Fields.MenuText: Then make yourself disappear until it does!
I admit you don't look like that kind of god.
Very well. We accept what we must.

Fields.DialogueText: Poof, just like that? Are you sure that's wise? We're in dangerous territory.
I may not be one of the great powers, but I'm a Kami all the same. We move in mysterious ways.
My funnels used to heat up the crew's quarters something fierce. You can take a little smoke.
What's got you so worked up, anyway?
I've heard back from the INPF. About my ideas for long-range assaults.
I'm guessing they didn't agree with your assessment of the tactical situation.
If I could sail to Zurich and give them a piece of my mind, I'd be there faster than one of my planes!
@BATTLE
... You're aware that Zurich's inla-
Kuso! Let me blow something up. Even if I'm to do it with blinders on.
Not far enough inland to escape me!
Kaga, reports have returned from that operation we discussed.
And?
The results weren't good. It seems your insight was correct.
Always good to know in hindsight...
Contain your sarcasm, Kaga. I reiterated your opinions to Command. They made their choice. They want your input about how to make better ones.
You... you agree with me? I mean, of course you agree! I was right all along!

Fields.MenuText: Of course. You've proven your worth already.
I felt it prudent, nothing more.
Only to quiet your complaining. Nothing more, nothing less.

Fields.DialogueText: Down, Kanchou! If I blush any more I might set off the sprinklers.
There's nothing more prudent than an overwhelming first strike!
I'll have to complain more often!
Duly noted.
I suppose I should thank you. Hmm... perhaps I'll cut you in on my next cigarette shipment. Oh! Or maybe I'll teach you some karuta...
We can discuss my reward later. Let's catch up to those Morganas...
@BATTLE
Kaga, can we discuss your bomber wings for a moment?
Of course, Kanchou. I thought you'd never ask!
I noticed you've been shaving off some of their armor. The pilots have expressed some concerns about their safety.
Are they complaining?
They're answering when asked.
And who is asking?

Fields.MenuText: I am. And?
That isn't your concern, understood?
Someone who expects answers without being questioned themselves.

Fields.DialogueText: They're my pilots. If they have concerns they should come to me about them.
If it concerns my pilots, it better be!
Then you'll be pretty disappointed. My bombers, my pilots, my problem, agreed?
Kaga, this...
Kanchou, you ever look at where a plane's gotten hit when it comes back?
Of course. I've seen some I couldn't believe were still flight-capable.
Ever notice that they never seem to have been hit in the engine or the cockpit?
@BATTLE
Because if you're hit there, you're probably not... ah. I see.
Are we netting less armor in general? Of course. The less weight, the better the control. Are we putting it where it can do some real good? Also yes.
You hadn't communicated this to the pilots?
I thought they'd figure it out the way you just did! Maybe it should be you up in the air...
I'll pass.
Well, obviously not for these specific Morganas we're up against today. But my offer stands if you're itching to earn your wings...
Kanchou, you were asking me about the bombers and their reduced armor earlier.
You mentioned that speed was a primary concern of yours.
Armor's all well and good, Kanchou, but only if you're hit in the first place.
Wouldn't the armor grant our pilots greater safety as well?
To a degree, of course. But speed's everything in the air. Less weight means faster planes, higher flights, longer distances...
And less armor.
It's a tradeoff. Necessary, even.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure the pilots and their families feel the same.
Necessary by whose standards?
So putting pilots at risk is just a price of victory then?

Fields.DialogueText: They can be made to understand, Kanchou! I'm telling you, if you could see the planes that didn't make it home...
By the standards of victory, Kanchou, and the need to sacrifice to obtain it.
For a few to be at risk in defense of thousands, absolutely.
Understand that I'm not complaining about the actions themselves, just the manner in which they were done.
Next time, check with me first. Bring me that argument you kept from the pilots and you'll likely get your way.
Well, if they'd only asked... Fine. Heard and understood.
Good. Now, I think it's about time for our daily interruption.
Way ahead of you, Kanchou. They'll be capsizing themselves just to put out the fire!
@BATTLE
Have a moment, Kanchou?
For my favorite Kami? Always.
Of course I'm your favorite. Who else would it be?
Another joke, Kaga. Didn't you ask me once whether I understood them?
Joking about a compliment, eh? Bold. Come at me again when you've got a better punchline.
I'll keep that in mind, but time is precious. What can I do for you?
I was thinking about our discussion on armor. I wanted to get your opinion on what we can do to my structure to speed me up.
We could always throw off the first Kami we see and hope that we burn fuel better.
Two jokes in one day? What's a lady to think?

Fields.MenuText: That life is hard enough without a few smiles.
That you're in the right place at the right time.
Lady? Who said anything about a lady?

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! That just means you have to make life harder for the enemy!
With the right kanchou, I hope.
I'll wring that honorific out of you yet.
Your armor solution seems to be working just fine for the pilots, but I don't know that speed should be our priority.
Call it curiosity, Kanchou. Imagine crippling an enemy with our bombers and steaming up to deliver the coup de grace!
Now you're speaking my language!
@BATTLE
Assuming they survive in the first place.
Loud enough for today's Morganas to hear?
It'll be ringing in their ears to the bottom of the sea!
Kaga? I'd like to discuss your thoughts on speeding up the ship.
Truly? I didn't think you were interested given how quickly you left the bridge last time.
You're not my only concern, you know. I have other crew and officers to command.
Nan demo. Now, about those tweaks I recommended in my brief...
Yes, about them. I want to make it clear that you're to make no changes to the ship's hull without my express permission. That goes for guns, armor, props... anything along those lines.
I thought we were coming to an understanding?
This doesn't have so much to do with you as it has to do with respecting the chain of command. My superiors expect certain protocols to be followed. Those who break the chain break their trust.
We could save lives if you'd let  me work!

Fields.MenuText: Then bring it to me first.
You and every other captain with the right idea.
I don't like it any more than you do.

Fields.DialogueText: I... Very well, Kanchou.
Other captains aren't ships!
Hmph. Bureaucrats.
In a perfect world these wars would move at the speed of the people who actually fought them.
Couldn't agree more, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Do your pilots trust you?
Once I clued them in... they warmed to my ideas. Even if they should have figured them out on their own.
The Fleet should be pleased to know that. And I know you don't care what they think, but-
But nothing. They want results? They want my reasoning? I'll show them! ... Within reason, of course.
You can be a little unreasonable with these Morganas.
Thank the Emperor for that, or I might burst into flames.
Take a look at the board and tell me what you see.
I see... hmm... is this a recreation of the battle at Tsushima?
Very observant. Yes, I've recreated the battle order but upgraded the ships to reflect current capabilities.
It's a fun exercise. What's the point?
These Morganas we're fighting aren't using what we would call standard tactics. Therefore, we need to force ourselves to rethink our own.
By reliving the past?
In order to break the future, yes. I believe this is a perfect match for you, Kaga. After all, the battle was won by range and speed over armor, yes?
As I understand it, yes. What do you want me to do now?
Take a look at the dispositions on the board and tell me how you'd engage the Russian fleet.
Give me a minute.

Fields.MenuText: Take all the time you need.
I'm just doing a thought experiment, Kaga, not drilling you for Admiral. What do you think?
First thing out of your mind, now, go!

Fields.DialogueText: It's obvious, Kanchou. The best way – strike from a distance. Speed and range, just like you said.
They're expecting a strike, so I'd send in low-flight torpedo planes.
Uhh... cloud the skies with air cover and blow them to bits with guns if they make the mistake of coming within range.
Good. Tell me, how do you feel about radios?
You know I can't stand any problems with them. There's just no excuse, no excuse!
Precisely. We...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
All right, theory over. Time for practice!
Another exercise, Kanchou?
You have something better to do?
Is that a trick question, or did you want another brief?
Battles aren't all about bombs and bullets, Kaga. They're about planning and preparation. Failure to prepare is like building a castle on sand. Do you know what that means?
It means that you know more about this than I do, and you're going to prove it?

Fields.MenuText: Come on. I'll give you a tougher one this time.
Have you no respect for processes?
Fake wars don't risk real lives.

Fields.DialogueText: You're certainly welcome to try.
Not really, but thanks for asking.
Failure to adapt does.
If I could flip a switch and put you in charge of tactics and modifications, I would. It'd be a load off my mind.
Now where's your sense of teamwork, Kanchou! You have your part to play in this every bit as much as I do.
Of course. And that is-
-To watch my back while I rain hell on our enemies.
I'll take it. As long as you're guarding mine.
Commencing hell rain!
@BATTLE
Also that Command would prefer a dossier of war exercises as proof of concept.
They've got a real war already. They don't need a fake one.
Kaga. Correct me if I'm wrong, but you look like you want to ask me something.
... Hai.
Please do.
What did you mean, Kanchou, when you said I'd be guarding your back?

Fields.MenuText: I meant that I trust you to do it.
I meant that I need your bombers.
I meant that I need your strength.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Kanchou. I won't betray that trust.
They're ready any time, Captain. You can count on them... and on me.
Power recognizes power.
These Morganas are terrifying to be sure, but you hold your own against them. I'd like to see you do more.
Your words bring me honor, Kanchou. You've frustrated me in the past, but I know you mean well.
My words are mere tokens, Kaga. Take them as you will.
@BATTLE
They're like any currency. They've got to be backed by something.
So our trust is as good as gold, then?
There's other metals. But we're getting there.
Let's shoot some at the Morganas.
Kanchou, have you seen my- ah.
I picked this up thinking it was the brief. Wins... losses... odds... have you been gambling with the crew?
Define gambling.

Fields.MenuText: You should know what it is – you've been doing it!
The transference of wealth through chance.
Taking advantage of those under you with your advanced knowledge.

Fields.DialogueText: Damn straight. I've got to get my smokes from somewhere!
I tried to stop, honest I did. But my sailors are just soooooo damn unlucky...
That's what war is too. If that's off the cards, we might as well call the war off!
Enough, Kaga! Do you recall our discussion on the chain of command?
Word for word, Kanchou.
Then you should understand why I caution against gambling aboard this ship. A few games here and there isn't a problem, but too many...
Well, no matter how the cards fall, you lose.
House always wins, Kanchou, and out here at sea that's me.
My point exactly. Winning more than you lose as an officer among enlisted fosters resentment. You are especially vulnerable to this in your... unique... position.
Are you saying I shouldn't gamble?
I'm not saying anything like that. I'm only advising you to use discernment.
You mean... throw games?
Just consider losing a bit more, would you? Without letting the crew know?
Afraid I can't do that. Holding an advantage in my hands and throwing it away... it goes against everything I am as a Belle. As a person.
@BATTLE
The crew know this. That's why I keep a careful record of wins and losses and check it against their pay religiously. You win the war, you inherit the peace.
That's... actually a really good point. All right, Kaga. You've convinced me. In any event, here's your little black book back. You've clearly been putting it to responsible use.
Appreciate it, Kanchou. Besides, if I had to pay for all my smokes I'd blow my personal budget inside a week.
... Kaga, just how much do you-
Not as much as these Funayūrei are about to!
Another drill?
Inaction breeds discontent.
So does repetition. Do you think we're inactive?
Not in the least. Consider this: idle hands are the devil's workshop.
And people who are exhausted perform worse.
Are you saying I'm working my crew too hard?
I'm not not saying it.

Fields.MenuText: Just speak the truth, Kaga!
You're saying I'm working the crew too hard?
Then what are you saying?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes! For the love of the Emperor, give them a break!
They're my crew too, and you're running them ragged!
We're blowing the drills out of the water when we could be blowing them into space. There, happy?
Your concerns are noted, Kaga. You've come a long way since we started together. I'm proud that you could speak your mind.
Well, while we're on the subject, I think you should tell Command they can-
Don't push it.
@BATTLE
Yoshi, yoshi. We'll give 'em an object lesson.
... And if we remove these hull plates here and here and replace them with the lighter versions...
... We set ourselves up for disaster should we take a direct hit.
Yare yare. What do you suggest? We need more speed for the planes to achieve greater takeoff velocities.
I know I'll regret this, but why? They seem to be doing fine at our present capabilities.
Weren't you the one telling me to look for ways to break the future? If we need to launch quickly but can't catch the wind, more speed will solve the issue.
But at the risk of losing the entire ship to a single lucky shot? No, I cannot abide that thought.
I'm the lucky one, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: I said no, Kaga. End of discussion.
Thank you again, but we're through here.
Don't mention this again. That's an order.

Fields.DialogueText: Why... Grr... Ignora... Ahem. Fine.
Using the royal we, I see.
You're folding pocket aces, Kanchou.
What's the point of coming to you with these things if you're going to shoot them down?
That, right there. You push me to take risks and I keep you grounded. You'll get your moment on the battlefield.
I'll get my moment when you... grr. Fine.
Turn the equation around, Kaga. What's your ideal battle?
Dropping a meteor's worth of bombs on an enemy that never saw us coming.
We've got armor to prevent that from happening to us. You know how vulnerable you are to indirect fire, especially on your flight decks. And don't forget those fuel tanks of yours.
I've said it before and I'll say it again, Kanchou. Armor keeps you trapped in a frame of mind that expects to get hit. He who strikes first wins!
Prove it.
*ALARM*
Oh, I'm going to enjoy this...
@BATTLE
Kaga? I have news from Command.
Kuso! That barrel of softies wouldn't know an opportunity if-
I sent in your thoughts on weight and speed to high command. They've not only agreed to look into it for construction on the next generation of carriers; they're interested in hearing more.
I thought you weren't interested.
I wasn't, but apparently Command thought otherwise. Remember, I do what I do for the entire crew. Just because I think I can't use a suggestion doesn't mean it is bad.
Kanchou, I...

Fields.MenuText: We've been over this, Kaga. You've already proven your worth. Don't thank me.
We've been over this, Kaga. Prudence, nothing more.
At the very least, you'll stop complaining.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! I told you this day would come!
Overwhelming firepower is just another version of prudence!
Oh, I'll find something to complain about. First step to fixing something!
I guess I shouldn't have expected humility.
Now, now... make no mistake. I couldn't have gotten here without you.
You mean that?
Nani?
They're interested in your ideas.
Of course I mean it! I persevere all the harder when you tell me something can't be done. You've got that reverse psychology crap nailed.
That... was my angle the whole time. Yes, indeed. Good guess.
Is it luck, or intuition? Hey, Funayūrei! One explosion for luck, two for intuition!
@BATTLE
Care for a cigarette, Kanchou?
No, thank you. At least you're smoking outside for once.
Yes, yes, I'm trying to be considerate.
I appreciate that.
Hey, Kanchou? Can I ask you something?

Fields.MenuText: A friendship of equals, Kaga. I'm proud to have you on my team.
An odd... couple? Yes... I'd certainly say so.

Fields.DialogueText: I've heard talk of banning the practice altogether on ships. Can you believe that milquetoast nonsense?
There's merit to it. Enclosed spaces, volatile materials...
Pah. My sailors need to relax once in a while. I can get more if they can't do it responsibly. That's their malfunction.
You've patched yours up quite satisfactorily.
Growth recognizes growth, Kanchou Scared-of-a-few-shells. The IJN see the value in speed. So shall the world, now that these witches have shrunk it.
I promise to make the most of it.
Arigato. My offer stands, you know. Don't squander it.
In a way I'm honored.
Back at you.
Heh. Watch yourself, Kanchou. When I like an idea I run with it.
I'll hold you to that.
Anything.
I know I can be hard on you. And a little abrasive.
Not to mention loud.
Urusai! Baring my soul here.
Bare away.
The pilots know this, but I only go so hard because I know you can take it. Because that's the kind of challenge I rise to. You too. It's why I picked you.
No hard feelings, Kaga. I can't argue with the results or the perseverance that drives them.
We're a bit of an odd couple, I know, but... we make a good team, don't you think?
